author: Special Correspondent
text:
Works including painting of the seven-tier Rajagopuram for the ‘kumbabhishekam’ of Arulmigu Kapaleeswarar Temple in Mylapore are progressing well.

Works to renovate and paint the 14 vimanas (domes) above the sanctum sanctorums is nearing completion. Minister for Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments R. Kamaraj on Wednesday visited the temple, where the works are being carried out at a cost of Rs. 6.53 crore, a press release said.

The idol of Lord Kapaleeswarar will get a gold nagabharanam and a swarnabhandanam and that of Goddess Karpagambal a golden paavadai and a swarnabhandanam — a golden sheet to cover the pedestal below the feet of the deities.

The temple car and 45 wooden vahanams have been restored at a cost of Rs. 40 lakh. The works are likely to take another month and half. It was in 2004 that the last Kumbabhishekam was held at the temple, the release added.
title: Works on a fast pace at Kapaleeswarar temple
